name: 90s Character IDs Part 2 Trivia Quiz | Movies by Year | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which film featured the character of Lt. Lenina Huxley?
questions.explanation:
Demolition Man.

	Sandra Bullock starred as the lovely and overzealous Lt. Lenina Huxley in this 1993 futuristic comedy action adventure flick. She played a cop who was obsessed with old cop movies. "Demolition Man" centered around an evil convict, Simon Phoenix, who had escaped from prison and reigned terror on the now peaceful society of the future. Only one man could stop him, former policeman and nemesis John Spartan. Wesley Snipes and Sylvester Stallone starred as evil foes in this movie.

questions.text: Which romantic comedy featured the character of Sam Baldwin?
questions.explanation:
Sleepless in Seattle.

	Sam Baldwin was a lonely widower who had all but given up on love until his young son stepped in and tried to fix him up. The ever popular Tom Hanks starred as the sad Sam Baldwin along with Meg Ryan as Annie Reed in "Sleepless in Seattle".

questions.text: Which epic film featured the character of Pamela Courson?
questions.explanation:
The Doors.

	Meg Ryan starred as Jim Morrison's dedicated girlfriend in the 1991 epic film "The Doors". This classic rock 'n roll film discussed the ups and down of the band and also dealt with the early tragic death of the lead singer Jim Morrison.

questions.text: In which Courteney Cox film from the 1990s would you find the character Melissa Robinson?
questions.explanation:
Ace Ventura:  Pet Detective.

	Courteney Cox starred as a member of the Miami Dolphins organization who hired Ace Ventura, a pet detective, to find the team's missing mascot, Snowflake. She helped him in his quest to solve the mystery and ended up falling for him. This blockbuster was released in 1994.

questions.text: Which supernatural mega-hit featured the character of Carl Bruner?
options: Twin Peaks:  Fire Walk With Me
questions.explanation:
Ghost.

	Tony Goldwyn starred as the deceitful best friend of Patrick Swayze in the blockbuster hit from 1990. "Ghost" told the haunting story of a young widow and her boyfriend's effort to say his final goodbye. Apart from acting Tony has also gotten into directing such feature films as "A Walk on the Moon" and "Someone Like You".

questions.text: In which John Grisham based film did Kiefer Sutherland portray Freddie Lee Cobb?
questions.explanation:
A Time to Kill.

	This 1996 drama told the story of a black man who shot and killed two men who were responsible for raping his young daughter. The story centered around the trial and a lawyer who got caught up in more than he bargained on. Kiefer Sutherland had a supporting role of an evil Klu Klux Klan member. This film also starred Matthew McConnaughey, Sandra Bullock, and Ashley Judd.

questions.text: Which action star portrayed Miss Noxeema Jackson in the comedy "To Wong Foo Thanks for Everything, Julie Newmar"?
questions.explanation:
Wesley Snipes.

	Three drag queens set out on a cross country road trip to attend the most grand drag queen pageant in California.  Wesley starred as the outrageous Noxeema Jackson, drag queen beauty, in this 1995 comedy. Wesley was the only lead actor who did not receive a Golden Globe nomination for his work on this movie. This film also starred Patrick Swayze, John Leguizamo, and Chris Penn. Mel Gibson and Gary Oldman were also considered for leads in this film.

questions.text: Which Reese Witherspoon film featured her in the role of Tracy Enid Flick?
questions.explanation:
Election.

	This chaotic comedy told the story of a young high school student, played by Reese Witherspoon, whose only ambition in life was to be the student council president. She did whatever was necessary to make sure that her dreams of reaching that goal came true, no matter what it cost anyone else. Matthew Broderick starred opposite Reese as a teacher who had other plans in mind for her. Alexander Payne directed this 1999 comedy.

questions.text: Which character did Dennis Haysbert portray in the 1994 comedy "Major League II"?
questions.explanation:
Pedro Cerrano.

	This sequel centered around the Cleveland Indians having success as a winning team. "Major League II" was Dennis Haysbert second time portraying this character. He originated the role of Pedro Cerrano in "Major League" in 1989. Pedro Cerrano was known for his crazy superstitions when he played baseball.

questions.text: Which film featured the character of U.S. Marshal Vince Larkin?
questions.explanation:
Con Air.

	John Cusack portrayed a U.S. Marshal who set out to rescue a plane that had been taken over by a bunch of convicts. He stopped at nothing to make sure that he got the bad guys. This 1997 action adventure film starred Nicolas Cage, John Malkovich, and Ving Rhames.
